intro: Rinorea engleriana, commonly known as the velvetleaf or velvet plant, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its velvety, hairy leaves that give it its common name. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Rinorea engleriana is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and ability to thrive in warm, humid climates.
